sentence.Network_en: I've had enough—there are limits even for the patience of a saint!
sentence.Network_cn: 我已经受够了——即使是圣人忍耐也是有限的！

sentence.Network_en: Chiswick church is dedicated to St Nicholas, patron saint of sailors.
sentence.Network_cn: 奇西克教堂为水手的守护神圣尼古拉而建。

sentence.Network_en: My girlfriend is a saint to put up with me.
sentence.Network_cn: 能够忍受我，我的女朋友真的很有耐心。

means.word_mean: 1. a battle in the Meuse-Argonne operation in World War I (1918); the battle in which American troops launched their first offensive in France

auth_sentence.content: Ms. Davis is treated here as a virtual saint.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ms. Davis is treated here as a virtual saint.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ms. Davis is treated here as a virtual saint.

auth_sentence.content: It depicts the saint as he is barbecued alive.
auth_sentence.res_content: It depicts the saint as he is barbecued alive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It depicts the saint as he is barbecued alive.

auth_sentence.content: Let's have a Saint-Julien, a late-growth Saint-Julien.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's have a Saint-Julien, a late-growth Saint-Julien.
